quiz.question: The property of wave shown in the diagram above is?

Which of the following statements regarding the application of electrical conduction via gases is/are correct? Electrical conduction in gas is applied in: (i) Identification of gases (ii) Lighting/fluorescent tubes (iii) Photocells (iv) Cathode ray oscilloscope/T.V. tubes
Find the tension in the two cords shown in the figure above. Neglect the mass of the cords, angle = 38°, mass = 220 kg. [Take g = 9.8 m/s²]
A missile is launched with a speed of 75 m/s at an angle of 22° above the surface. Find the horizontal range achieved. [Take g = 10 m/s²]
On a hot day, temperature = 40°C, partial pressure of water vapor = 38.8 mmHg. Find the relative humidity.
Calculate the absolute pressure at the bottom of a lake at a depth of 32.8 m. Water density = 1000 kg/m³, air pressure = 101.3 kPa. [Take g = 9.8 m/s²]
The terminals of a battery of emf 24 V and internal resistance 1 Ω is connected to an external resistor 5 Ω. Find the terminal p.d.
A lorry accelerates uniformly at 4 m/s² and covers 250 m in 10 s. How far will it travel in the next 10 s?
The half-life of a radioactive material is 12 days. Calculate the decay constant.
The number of holes in an intrinsic semiconductor

options.A: is not equal to the number of free electrons
options.B: is greater than the number of free electrons
options.C: is equal to the number of free electrons
options.D: is less than the number of free electrons

quiz.question: Name the type of equilibrium for each position of the ball

options.A: A - unstable, B - neutral, C - stable
options.B: A - stable, B - neutral, C - unstable
options.C: A - stable, B - unstable, C - neutral
options.D: A - unstable, B - stable, C - neutral

quiz.question: Rainbow formation is as a result of the combination of which of the following phenomena? (i) Reflection (ii) Dispersion (iii) Total internal reflection (iv) Refraction

The surface temperature of a swimming pool on a warm day is 25ºC and the temperature at the bottom is 15ºC. The swimming pool has a surface area of 620 m² and a depth of 1.5 m. Find the rate at which energy is transferred by conduction. [Thermal conductivity of water k = 0.6071 W/m·K]
Which process is responsible for production of energy in stars?
How much net work is required to accelerate a 1200 kg car from 10 m/s to 15 m/s?
A wire of radius 0.2 mm is extended by 0.5% of its length when supported by a load of 1.5 kg. Determine the Young's modulus for the material of the wire. [Take g = 10 m/s²]
A man swung an object of mass 2 kg in a circular path with a rope 1.2 m long. If the object was swung at 120 rev/min, find the tension in the rope.
A 200 kg load is raised using a 110 m long lever. The load is 10 m from the pivot P. If the efficiency of the lever is 80%, find the effort E required to lift the load. [Take g = 10 m/s²]

An air bubble of radius 4.5 cm initially at a depth of 12 m below the water surface rises to the surface. If the atmospheric pressure is equal to 10.34 m of water, find the radius of the bubble just before it reaches the surface.
A parallel plate capacitor separated by an air gap is made of 0.8 m² tin plates and 20 mm apart. It is connected to 120 V battery. Find the charge on each plate. [ε₀ = 8.85×10⁻¹² F/m]

What is the amount of heat required to raise the temperature of a 0.02 kg ice cube from −10°C to 10°C? [Specific latent heat of fusion of ice = 3.34×10⁵ J/kg, Specific heat capacity of water = 4200 J/kg·K, Specific heat capacity of ice = 2100 J/kg·K]
Which of the following thermometers measures temperature from the thermal radiation emitted by objects?

A 400 N box is being pushed across a level floor at a constant speed by a force P of 100 N at an angle of 30° to the horizontal. Find the coefficient of kinetic friction between the box and the floor.
Light of wavelength 589 nm in vacuum passes through a piece of fused quartz of index of refraction n = 1.458. What is the frequency of the light in fused quartz? [Speed of light c = 3.00×10⁸ m/s]
A simple pendulum has a period of 5.77 seconds. When the pendulum is shortened by 3 m, the period is 4.60 seconds. Calculate the new length of the pendulum.
